original_solution_mapping.L1: Since 1 hour is 60 minutes, 20 minutes is 20/60=1/3 of an hour.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Eating 3 potatoes per 20 minutes is 3/(1/3)=<<3/(1/3)=9>>9 potatoes per hour.
original_solution_mapping.L3: At 9 potatoes per hour, it will take Jason 27/9=3 hours to eat all of the potatoes.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2562.
    Returns: the time it takes for Jason to eat all potatoes in hours.
    """
    # L1
    time_per_three_potatoes_minutes = 20 # three potatoes in 20 minutes
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # 1 hour is 60 minutes
    time_per_three_potatoes_hours = Fraction(time_per_three_potatoes_minutes, minutes_per_hour)

    # L2
    potatoes_per_interval = 3 # three potatoes
    potatoes_per_hour = potatoes_per_interval / time_per_three_potatoes_hours

    # L3
    total_potatoes = 27 # all 27 potatoes
    total_time_hours = total_potatoes / potatoes_per_hour

    # FA
    answer = total_time_hours
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Since 1 hour is {minutes_per_hour} minutes, {time_per_three_potatoes_minutes} minutes is {time_per_three_potatoes_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={time_per_three_potatoes_hours} of an hour.

Eating {potatoes_per_interval} potatoes per 20 minutes is {potatoes_per_interval}/({time_per_three_potatoes_hours})=<<{potatoes_per_interval}/({time_per_three_potatoes_hours})={potatoes_per_hour}>>{potatoes_per_hour} potatoes per hour.
At {potatoes_per_hour} potatoes per hour, it will take Jason {total_potatoes}/{potatoes_per_hour}={total_time_hours} hours to eat all of the potatoes.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Since 1 hour is 60 minutes, 20 minutes is 20/60=20/60 of an hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Eating 3 potatoes per 20 minutes is 3/(20/60)=<<3/(20/60)=9>>9 potatoes per hour.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: At 3 potatoes per hour, it will take Jason 27/3=9 hours to eat all of the potatoes.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'potatoes_per_interval' (value: 3) was used instead of 'potatoes_per_hour' (value: 9).
